Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk caribou
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: gnome compositor stack bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: GNOME 3 is the default desktop environment in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. This update contains a number of rebases to the latest upstream stable versions, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous versions. For more information on the upstream changes, see the GNOME release notes in the References section and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2 Release Notes. The gnome-shell packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.3. (BZ#1174373) The gnome-menus packages have been upgraded to version 3.13.3. (BZ#1174388) The cogl packages have been upgraded to version 1.18.2. (BZ#1174508) The clutter packages have been upgraded to version 1.20.0. (BZ#1174509) The clutter-gst2 packages have been upgraded to version 2.0.12. (BZ#1174515) The gjs packages have been upgraded to version 1.42.0. (BZ#1174518) The gdm packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.1. (BZ#1174564) The gnome-shell-extensions packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.2. (BZ#1174574) The caribou packages have been upgraded to version 0.4.16. (BZ#1174709) The mutter packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.2. (BZ#1174722) This update also fixes the following bugs: Previously, the anaconda installer did not honor the "xconfig --startxonboot --defaultdesktop=KDE" line and the machine continued booting in the GNOME session. This bug has been fixed, and the machine now boots with desktop environment set to KDE as expected. (BZ#1141676) When upgrading to a newer version of gnome-shell, the login banner visibility was previously reduced. This bug has been fixed, and gnome-shell upgrade no longer causes visibility changes. (BZ#1182223) This update adds the missing option used for starting the Xorg server, "-audit 4", back to the default flags. (BZ#1188665) This update backports the fix for improper week number calculation in GNOME Calendar. (BZ#1207414) Under some conditions, multiline login banner text displayed on the login screen was wrapped incorrectly, overflowing the login prompt. This bug has been fixed, and longer texts are now autodetected to enter two column mode when needed. (BZ#1214503) When the list was long, the login screen failed to show all the users. This update adds a scrollbar so that the list of users is shown as expected and fits the screen. (BZ#1215328) Previously, the login banner placement checks failed to properly detect text overflow. As a consequence, the banner was displayed incorrectly. With this update, the layout now switches to the "book view" with the login banner on the left when the display resolution requires it. (BZ#1217157) Previously, the user could not set a long banner message, as the message overflew the login field. With this update longer texts are autodetected to enter two-column mode when needed. (BZ#1217522) A bug in the GNOME compositor previously caused some visual artifacts on the graphical screen. An upstream mutter patch has been provided to fix this bug, and the mentioned artifacts no longer appear. (BZ#1218434, BZ#1258842) Previously, under certain circumstances, the login screen prompted for user name twice, which led to an authentication failure. This bug has been fixed, and the login screen now prompts for password as expected. (BZ#1220023) If the system was up for a long time, the user was unable to launch applications from the Applications menu. This update fixes the open_new_window() method call in apps-menu extension, and applications are now launched as intended. (BZ#1229676) In the settings dialog for the Window List extension (gnome-shell-extension-prefs), there is a new check box "Show on all monitors". As a result, the user with multiple monitors has a window list available that shows applications open on all of their monitors. (BZ#1263368, BZ#1214306) Users of gnome compositor stack are advised to upgrade to all the rebased GNOME packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
